property.description: The UNC path to the deployment share
The UNC path to resources (drivers, packages) kept separate from the deployment share
The drive letter mapped to the deployment share (Lite Touch only)
The drive letter mapped to resources (drivers, packages) kept separate from the deployment share (Lite Touch only)
The method being used for the deployment (NETWORK, MEDIA, OSD, etc.)
The type of deployment (NEWCOMPUTER, REFRESH, REPLACE) being performed
The current phase of the deployment (NEWCOMPUTER, STATECAPTURE, PREINSTALL, INSTALL, POSTINSTALL, STATERESTORE)
Disk Number that the image will be deployed to
Disk Partition that the image will be deployed to
User ID used for connecting to network paths
Domain for the user ID used to connect to network paths
Password for the user ID used to connect to network paths
User data share used for capturing user state to a network path
Directory on the user data share where user state should be placed
List of profiles that should be captured by USMT as part of the user state
Script log share where all BDD scripts should be copied at the end of the deployment process
Script log share where all BDD events should be written during execution (advanced debugging only)
Event share UNC where all BDD scripts should write events for MOM management pack
Event web service where scripts should send events
Flag to indicate whether this machine is authorized for an OS deployment (if set, it must be YES or Y to proceed)
The new computer name to assign to the computer
The new computer name to assign to the computer (used with ConfigMgr)
The Internet Explorer home page that should be used on the computer
The name of the domain that should be joined (do not set if using JoinWorkgroup)
The name of the Workgroup that should be joined (do not set if using JoinDomain)
Account used to join to Domain (may be in 'Domain\UserName' or 'UserName@Domain.com' format)
Domain of Account used to join to Domain (Vista Only, must be blank if 'DomainAdmin' conains domain)
Password of Account used to join to Domain
The OU that should be used when the computer is joined to the domain (only if the computer account does not already exist)
OSD flag to indicate that no OSD new computer wizard should be displayed
OSD variable to indicate which SMS OSD package should be installed (only used for new computer)
OSD variable to indicate which program should be used for the specified OSD package (only used for new computer)
OSD variable that specifies the computer name that should be assigned (only used for new computer)
Command line arguments that should be added to the USMT Scanstate command line
Command line arguments that should be added to the USMT Scanstate command line
Command line arguments that should be added to the USMT Loadstate command line
Command line arguments that should be added to the USMT Scanstate command line
Specifies where the computer backup should be stored (AUTO, NETWORK, NONE, specific path, default is AUTO)
Network share (UNC) where the computer backup should be stored
Directory on the network share where the computer backup should be stored
Drive to include in the backup (defaults to the drive with disk 0 partition 1, can be set to ALL)
Full path to the USMT user state store that should be restored onto a particular machine
Flag to indicate that the machine should be Sysprepped and captured as a new WIM image
Product key string that should be inserted into unattend.xml, sysprep.inf, or unattend.txt
Multiple activation key (MAK) that should be applied after Windows Vista is deployed
Name of the WDS server that should be used when installing WDS images (default is the server that contains the original image)
Specifies whether to capture the local group membership from the machine (default is YES; ALL can also be specified)
Specifies the local administrator password to assign (default is to use existing value)
Specifies the organization name (default is none)
Specifies the full name (default is none)
TimeZone Identifier for Windows XP Builds (example: PST = 004 )
TimeZone Identifier for Windows Vista Builds (example: PST = 'Pacific Standard Time')
TaskSequence ID used to automate LTI/ZTI build selection (default is blank)
Build ID used to automate LTI/ZTI build selection (default is blank)
Locale used for Keyboard, can be either 0409:00000409 or en-US format (default is OS Default)
Locale used for Keyboard in WinPE Only, 0409:00000409 format (default is WinPE OS Default)
Locale used for Keyboard, (XP only, example: 0409:00000409, default is OS Default)
Default System Locale used for the OS (XP only, example: 0409:00000409)
Locale used for user when logged in, en-US format (default is OS Default)
Default Locale used for OS before user is logged in, en-US format (default is OS Default)
The Horizontal Resolution of the screen (example: 1024, default is OS Default)
The Vertical Resolution of the screen (example: 768, default is OS Default)
The Color Depth of the screen in Bits Per Pixel (example: 32, default is OS Default)
The vertical Refresh rate of the monitor in Hz (example: 60, default is OS Default)
Area code for the computer's location.
Country/region code to use for telephony.
Number to dial to gain access to an outside line, such as 9.
Type of dialing to use for the telephony device in the computer, such as 'Tone' or 'Pulse' (XP only).
Specifies the type of BDE install. (KEY|TPMKey|TPMPin|TPM)
Boolean to indicate whether a BDE Install should be attempted.
(Deprecated) Specifies the type of BDE install. (KEY|TPMKey|TPMPin|TPM)
Specifies the drive to be encrypted (default OS Drive)
Specifies the location of Key files (Drive)
(Deprecated) Specifies the location of Key files (Drive)
Indicates whether a recovery password should be generated for AD.
(Deprecated) Indicates whether a recovery password should be generated for AD.
Boolean (any value) indicated whether process should be held to wait for drive encryption to complete.
(Deprecated) Boolean (any value) indicated whether process should be held to wait for drive encryption to complete.
Drive Letter for BDE partition (default S:)
Drive size for BDE partition (default 2048MB)
BdePin for TPMPin
Disables offline pre-provisioning of BDE. Valid values are YES or NO
Allows Pin to be Alpha Numeric valid values are YES or NO ( Allow enhanced PINs for startup Group Policy must be applied )
Specifies the minimum pin length when using TPM and PIN (must be numeric)
Specifies the TPM Password for setting Ownership
Specifies the password to use for BDE Password scenarios
Specifies the value to use for startup key.
OSD variable to indicate which SMS management point should be used (only needed for new computer)
OSD variable to indicate which SMS site code should be used (only needed for new computer)
Server name to be used during the deployment process
Server name to be used during the deployment process
Server name to be used during the deployment process
USMT configuration XML file that should be used when running Scanstate and Loadstate
Specifies whether the disk should be wiped.
Customizes the Task Sequencer engine's display banner.
The URL of the WSUS server that should be used (optional, will use Windows Update or policyt settings by default)
Designates to always use USMT 3 Valid values are YES or NO
Designates to always use USMT 4 Valid values are YES or NO
Profile name used during driver installation.
Profile name used during Package installation.
Profile name used by the wizard for filtering the display of various items.
Custom SelectionProfile XML Blob used during driver installation.
Custom SelectionProfile XML Blob used during Package installation.
Custom SelectionProfile XML Blob used by the wizard for filtering the display of various items.
Do not include sub-folders when matching against Groups (example: DriverGroups, Default: Include Sub-Folders).
Profile name used to pre-load storage drivers before sysprep on XP/2003 (default is All Drivers)
Sets AutoMode for Server 2003 deployments
Sets AutoUsers for Server 2003 deployments
Space delimited list of error codes allowed by ZTIApplications.wsf (default: 0 3010)
Sets the name of the backup file used with ztibackup
Specifies that Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008R2 will not create the 300 MB system partition
Implementing Diskpart BIOS compatibility fix (see KB 931760 and KB 931761)
Allows imagex.exe /apply for Windows 6.x captured images (does not use Setup.exe servicing stack).
Diskpart partition alignment
Specifies what action should be taken when a Lite Touch task sequence completes (SHUTDOWN, REBOOT, LOGOFF, or default of none)
Specifies the username (e.g. DOM\USER) that should be used with a Run Command Line action that is configure to run as user
Specifies the password that should be used with a Run Command Line action that is configure to run as user
Specifies the preferred task sequence advertisement ID
Specifies a comma-delimeted list of primary users for the computer
Specifies if users can change the primary users for the computer (AUTO, PENDING, DISABLED)
Full path to be used for state capture and state restore
Task sequence package name displayed in the progress dialog (Lite Touch only).
Causes Lite Touch task sequence to run before Explorer loads if set to YES (Lite Touch only).
Disables Task Manager during deployment if set to YES (Lite Touch only and must be used with HideShell)).
Install Windows Recovery Environment into Active System partition.
Causes the GPO Pack to not be applied if the value is set to NO.
Overides the default path that is used for GPO Packs (.\Templates\GPOPacks).
Specifies a path to Validate the JoinDomain Credentials against. This UNC share must *not* be used by any other MDT component.
Sets the max storage space available for system restore. Can be specified in bytes or as a percentage(%) of the volume. Acceptable suffixes are KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, EB or %
Mechanism Apply OS step should use to determine where to install the OS (valid values are ByDriveLetter, ByVariable, ByDiskPartition, NextPartition)
Drive letter to deploy OS to (e.g. G:) when DestinationOSInstallType=ByVariable
Skips the rearming of Office if set to YES
Windows installation files (sxs) needed to install Windows 8 features that are not in the image
If set to YES, skips any formatting and partitioning that would have been performed
If set to TRUE, user state will be captured offline in Windows PE instead of from the current OS
Windows 10 Upgrade Additional Options
Option for Windows 10 Setup dynamic Upgrade
Flag to skip the deployment wizard altogether (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the capture of an image (if set to YES, default is YES)
Flag to skip the Administrator User Account Password wizard page(if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the wizard pane that asks for applications to be installed (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the computer backup wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the domain membership wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the Computer Name wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the initial deployment type wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the user data wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the packages (language packs) wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the locale selection wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the product key wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the final wizard summary screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the Summary_Definition_XXX.xml screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the BDD Welcome screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the TimeZone screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the Task Sequence (OS Selection) screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the Build (OS Selection) screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the BitLocker (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip BitLocker details screen (if set to YES, default is blank)
Flag to skip the Administrator Users screen (if *NOT* set to NO, default is blank, You must set to NO to display the page)
Flag to skip the Roles and Features wizard pane (if set to YES, default is blank)
Specifies which domain to join
Specifies which OU to use when joining the specified domain
Specifies which workgroup to join
Specifies the account to be used for joining a domain
Specifies the password to use with the OSDJoinAccount when joining a domain.
Specifies what the password for the local administrator account should be set to once the server has been imaged
Specifies which domain accounts, separated by semicolons, should be added to the administrators group.
Specifies which time zone the machine should be set to.
Specifies the architecture (x86 or amd64) of the OS that will be applied. Additionally this variable can be used to determine which applications and language packs to apply
Specifies the index of the image that should be applied from the WIM file.
Specifies volume that the specified image should be applied to.
Specifies the windows directory used for backing up user state
Specifies whether a OSDTargetDrive should be formatted or not.
Specifies which applications should be selected by default from the application page of the OSD Setup Wizard.
Specifies the locale that should be used for the UDI wizard (e.g. 0x407, 1031)
Number of Adapters defined here( either blank, 0 or 1)
If present, match all settings to the adapter with this name.
If present, match all settings to the adapter with this MAC address.
If false, will disable DHCP, otherwise True (true if blank).
Comma delimited list of IPAddress Lists
Comma delimited list of Subnet masks
Comma delimited list of Gateway cost metrics
Comma delimited list of Gateway Cost MEtrics as either integers, or the string 'Automatic' (if empty, uses automatic)
Comma delimited list of DNS Servers
DNS Suffix, example Frabrikam.com

True/False to enalbe Full DNS Registration
True/False to enable LMHosts
True/False to enable WINS

Comma delimited list of WINS Servers

Comma delimited list of IDP Filters
Comma delimited list of IP Protocol FIlters
Disk index used for Partitioning (Default is 0)
Number of Partitions listed here (Default is None, max of 2, use Default configuration)
Type of partition (Default: Primary, can be Logical or extended)
Type of File System (Default: NTFS, can be FAT32)

True/False - Shall the format be quick (default: True)
Volume name
